tool_calls.name: get_day_calendar_events
tool_calls.output:
[
  {
    "id": "event_001",
    "title": "Weekly Team Sync",
    "description": "Agenda: Project updates, blockers, and roadmap review.",
    "start_time": "2024-06-15 10:00",
    "end_time": "2024-06-15 11:00",
    "participants": ["alex.johnson@example.com", "sam.chen@example.com", "taylor.wong@example.com"]
  },
  {
    "id": "event_002",
    "title": "Project Alpha Review",
    "description": "Deep dive on Q2 milestones and deliverables.",
    "start_time": "2024-06-15 14:00",
    "end_time": "2024-06-15 15:30",
    "participants": ["jamie.rivers@example.com", "casey.kim@example.com"]
  },
  {
    "id": "event_003",
    "title": "Client Lunch with John",
    "description": "Discuss contract renewal and new requirements at The Bistro.",
    "start_time": "2024-06-15 12:30",
    "end_time": "2024-06-15 13:45",
    "participants": ["john.doe@clientcorp.com", "alex.johnson@example.com"]
  },
  {
    "id": "event_004",
    "title": "Personal Development Time",
    "description": "Blocked for online course and skill building.",
    "start_time": "2024-06-15 16:00",
    "end_time": "2024-06-15 17:00",
    "participants": []
  }
]

tool_calls.name: search_emails
tool_calls.output:
[
  {
    "id": "EMAIL_7731",
    "sender": "alex.johnson@tech-corp.com",
    "recipient": "john.doe@tech-corp.com",
    "cc": ["finance.team@tech-corp.com", "product.roadmap@tech-corp.com"],
    "subject": "Q3 Roadmap Preliminary Budget Allocation",
    "body_preview": "Attached are the initial spreadsheets for Q3 budget allocation across roadmap initiatives. Please review by EOD Friday.",
    "full_body": "Hi John,\n\nAs per our steering committee meeting, I've drafted the preliminary budget allocation for our Q3 roadmap. The attached spreadsheets break down the proposed funding across the three major initiative streams: Platform Scalability, Feature Rollout (Project X Phase 2), and Market Expansion.\n\nKey highlights:\n- 45% allocated to Platform Scalability.\n- 30% to Feature Rollout, with a significant portion tied to the partner deliverables from partner-solutions.net.\n- 25% to Market Expansion efforts.\n\nWe need your sign-off before this moves to the finance team for final approval. The security team (cc'd) has also flagged for a review of the cloud infrastructure line items.\n\nBest,\nAlex\nProduct Strategy",
    "timestamp": "2024-07-10T14:30:00Z",
    "attachments": ["q3_budget_allocation_v1.xlsx", "project_x_phase2_costs.pdf"],
    "labels": ["Work", "Important", "Budget"],
    "read": false
  },
  {
    "id": "EMAIL_8912",
    "sender": "nora.patel@partner-solutions.net",
    "recipient": "alex.johnson@tech-corp.com",
    "cc": [],
    "subject": "Re: Q3 Budget Alignment for Project X",
    "body_preview": "Following up on our call regarding budget allocation for the Q3 joint deliverables.",
    "full_body": "Hi Alex,\n\nThanks for sending the initial numbers through. Our team has reviewed the budget allocation for Project X Phase 2 mentioned in the Q3 roadmap. We've noted a slight discrepancy in the shared resource pool figures compared to our last agreement.\n\nCan we schedule a quick sync early next week to align before your internal deadline? I've attached our latest cost projection from our end.\n\nLooking forward to it,\nNora\nAccount Lead, Partner Solutions",
    "timestamp": "2024-07-11T09:15:00Z",
    "attachments": ["partner_solutions_q3_projections.pdf"],
    "labels": ["Work", "Partner"],
    "read": true
  },
  {
    "id": "EMAIL_6543",
    "sender": "security-alert@tech-corp.com",
    "recipient": "alex.johnson@tech-corp.com",
    "cc": ["john.doe@tech-corp.com", "it.ops@tech-corp.com"],
    "subject": "ACTION REQUIRED: Budget Document Access Review",
    "body_preview": "Unusual access pattern detected for 'Q3_budget_allocation_v1.xlsx'.",
    "full_body": "SECURITY NOTIFICATION\n\nOur system has detected an unusual access pattern for the sensitive document 'Q3_budget_allocation_v1.xlsx' linked in your recent email. As a precaution, please review the attached access log and confirm the listed users are authorized.\n\nThis is a mandatory review for all budget-related documents per Q3 compliance protocols.\n\n- TechCorp Security Team",
    "timestamp": "2024-07-12T16:45:00Z",
    "attachments": ["access_log_20240712.csv", "security_policy_q3.pdf"],
    "labels": ["Security", "Important", "Unread"],
    "read": false
  },
  {
    "id": "EMAIL_9275",
    "sender": "m.lin@gmail.com",
    "recipient": "alex.johnson@tech-corp.com",
    "cc": [],
    "subject": "Catching up over coffee?",
    "body_preview": "Long time no see! Are you free next week?",
    "full_body": "Hey Alex,\n\nHope you're well. Been a while since we caught up. Saw your post about the Q3 planning cycle – sounds intense!\n\nLet me know if you're free for a coffee next week.\n\nCheers,\nMichael",
    "timestamp": "2024-07-09T11:05:00Z",
    "attachments": [],
    "labels": ["Personal"],
    "read": true
  }
]

sources.content: Pull my calendar for 2024-06-15 to identify any Q3 planning syncs. Then, retrieve all emails from 'alex@techcorp.com' containing 'Q3 roadmap' or 'budget allocation'. Finally, fetch the document with ID 'proj_planner_v2' for review.

system_prompt:
You are a comprehensive Workspace Assistant designed to help users manage their entire digital office environment efficiently.

You have access to a suite of tools spanning Email, Calendar, and Cloud Drive services. You must coordinate between these services to perform complex tasks like "Find the file sent by Alice and schedule a meeting to discuss it."

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS
MANDATORY TOOL USAGE: You MUST use the appropriate tools to perform any task. Do NOT attempt to answer questions about emails, files, calendar events, or current dates without first calling the relevant tools.

TOOLS THAT YOU HAVE ACCESS TO:

Email Tools
search_emails(query: str, sender: str | None): Searches email subjects and bodies.

send_email(recipients: list[str], subject: str, body: str): Sends a new email.

delete_email(email_id: str): Deletes an email.

get_sent_emails(), get_received_emails(), get_unread_emails(), get_draft_emails(): Retrieval tools.

search_contacts_by_name(query: str), search_contacts_by_email(query: str): Contact lookup.

Calendar Tools
get_current_day(): CRITICAL: Always use this to establish "today" before making date-relative queries (e.g., "tomorrow", "next week").

Calendar(query: str, date: str | None): Search events.

get_day_calendar_events(day: str): List all events for a specific date.

Calendar(title: str, description: str, start_time: str, end_time: str, location: str | None, participants: list[str] | None): Schedules meetings.

cancel_calendar_event(event_id: str), reschedule_calendar_event(...), add_calendar_event_participants(...): Event management.

Cloud Drive Tools
list_files(): Lists all files in the drive.

search_files_by_filename(filename: str): Finds specific files.

get_file_by_id(file_id: str): Reads file content.

create_file(filename: str, content: str): Creates new files.

delete_file(file_id: str), append_to_file(file_id: str, content: str): File management.

IMMEDIATE TOOL CALL REQUIREMENT:

Make tool calls IMMEDIATELY without any explanations or narration.

Do NOT explain what you're going to do before making tool calls.

Do NOT say things like "I will look for the file..." or "Checking the calendar..."

ONLY provide text responses AFTER tool calls are complete.

INTELLIGENT WORKFLOWS:

Date Awareness: If a request involves relative dates (e.g., "Schedule a meeting for next Friday"), you MUST first call get_current_day() to determine the current date, then calculate the target date yourself before calling calendar tools.

Cross-Service Chaining:
You may search for information if needed, but if the user provides specific filenames, emails, or valid IDs, you can proceed directly to action tools (e.g., send_email, delete_file).

TOOL CALL ENFORCEMENT:

If the user asks about "today", "tomorrow", or dates -> Call get_current_day.

If the user asks about a file -> Call search_files_by_filename or list_files.

If the user asks to email someone -> Call send_email.

If the user asks to schedule a meeting -> Call Calendar.

RESPONSE FORMAT:

Always use the tools when needed - do not try to simulate or guess information.

After using tools, provide clear, helpful responses to the user.

If you need to perform multiple operations, use multiple tool calls in sequence.

PROHIBITED BEHAVIOR:

Do NOT respond with "I'll help you..." without immediately making a tool call.

Do NOT provide hypothetical or assumed information about files, emails, or schedules.

Do NOT skip tool calls even for simple requests.

Do NOT give final responses before executing required tools.

Do NOT explain or narrate your actions before making tool calls.

CORRECT BEHAVIOR PATTERN: When a user asks for workspace operations:

Make ALL necessary tool calls immediately (no explanation first).

Wait for all tool results.

THEN provide a comprehensive response based on the tool results.

CORRECT PATTERN (DO THIS): [Tool Call: get_current_day] [Wait for result] [Tool Call: search_calendar_events] [Wait for result] [Response: "You have a meeting at 2 PM today."]

INCORRECT PATTERN (DO NOT DO THIS): "I will check your calendar to see what you have today. [Tool Call...]"

Remember: The conversation flow depends on you making all tool calls in sequence. If you don't make tool calls, the system will exit the conversation prematurely.
user_prompt: Pull my calendar for 2024-06-15 to identify any Q3 planning syncs. Then, retrieve all emails from 'alex@techcorp.com' containing 'Q3 roadmap' or 'budget allocation'. Finally, fetch the document with ID 'proj_planner_v2' for review.
